byline.contributor: Vanessa Piao and Owen Guo contributed research.

abstract: Chinese media focuses on marriage of Hanscom Smith, United States consul general in Shanghai, to Taiwanese man Eric Lu in San Francisco; China  does not allow gay marriage and development serves as pointed reminder of prohibition.
lead_paragraph: The marriage in San Francisco of the American consul general in Shanghai to his Taiwanese partner generated interest in China, which does not allow same-sex marriage.

headline.main: U.S. Diplomat’s Same-Sex Marriage Causes Stir in China
headline.print_headline: Gay Marriage of Envoy Has China Talking

snippet: The marriage in San Francisco of the American consul general in Shanghai to his Taiwanese partner generated interest in China, which does not allow same-sex marriage.

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
